member.name: T:MPT.FileSystem.BrowseLibrary
member.summary: Contains functions for browsing for file or folder paths.

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.BrowseLibrary.BrowseForFilesFactory(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates an object to browse for a file or files.
member.param: Starting directory. Do not include filename.
Single label that describes the file type(s) provided.
List of file types to find. Multiple file types will apply to the same single label.
True: User can select multiple files, and multiple file paths will be returned.

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.BrowseLibrary.BrowseForFolderFactory(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates an object to browse for folders.
member.param: Description to be provided in the folder browser.
Default starting directory.
True: A button appears for creating new folders.

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.BrowseLibrary.OpenExplorerAtFolder(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Opens Windows Explorer at the specified directory.
member.param: Path to the folder to be opened.
Error message if the folder does not exist at the specified location.

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.BrowseLibrary.OpenExplorerAtFile(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Opens Windows Explorer at the specified directory and selects the specified file.
member.param: Path to the file to be selected.
Error message if the folder does not exist at the specified location.
Error message if the file does not exist at the specified location.

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.BrowseLibrary.BrowseForFile(System.String@,System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Browses for a single file and updates the file path. Returns 'False' if canceled.
member.param: Variable to write the file path to.
Starting directory. Do not include filename.
Single label that describes the file type(s) provided.
List of file types to find. Multiple file types will apply to the same single label.
member.returns: True if filename is chosen and valid. False otherwise.
member.remarks: dirPath currently is not working with this dialog.

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.BrowseLibrary.BrowseForFiles(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String}@,System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Browses for multiple files and updates the file paths list provided. Returns 'False' if canceled.
member.param: List to populate with one or more selected file paths.
Starting directory. Do not include filename.
Single label that describes the file type(s) provided.
List of file types to find. Multiple file types will apply to the same single label.
member.returns: True if filename is chosen and valid. False otherwise.
member.remarks: dirPath currently is not working with this dialog.

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.BrowseLibrary.BrowseForFolder(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: User selects a folder location. Folder location is returned as a string.
member.param: Description to be provided in the file browser.
Default starting directory.
True: A button appears for creating new folders.

member.name: T:MPT.FileSystem.FileLibrary
member.summary: Contains routines for working with file locations within folders. Used for file renaming, deleting, locating, relocating, etc.

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.FileLibrary.RenameFile(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Renames a file.
member.param: Path to file to renamed, including the file name and extension.
New file name and extension.

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.FileLibrary.SetFileNotReadOnly(System.String)
member.summary: Sets a specified file to not be read only.
member.param: File path, including the filename

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.FileLibrary.IsFileReadOnly(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if a file has any of the Read Only attributes assigned.
member.param: Path to the file to check.

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.FileLibrary.DeleteFile(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Deletes a single file of a specified path. Returns true if this results in the file no longer existing.
member.param: Path to the file to be deleted.
True: Removes read-only protection. False: Read-only files will not be deleted. Function will return False for read-only files.

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.FileLibrary.DeleteFiles(System.String,System.Boolean,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Deletes all files fitting the specified criteria. If no file name or extension is given, then all files will be deleted.
member.param: Path to the parent folder containing files to be deleted.
True: Files will be deleted in all subfolders. False: Files will only be deleted in the specified folder.
All files of this name will be deleted. Combine with myFileExtension to limit this to files of a particular name and type.
All files of this extension will be deleted.
True: Read only files will also be deleted. False: Read only files will be skipped.
List of filenames to preserve during the delete process.

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.FileLibrary.DeleteFilesBulk(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Deletes all files fitting the specified criteria lists. If no file name or extension is given, then all files will be deleted.
member.param: Path to the parent folder containing files to be deleted.
True: Files will be deleted in all subfolders. False: Files will only be deleted in the specified folder.
All files of the names in this list will be deleted. Combine with myFileExtensions to limit this to files of a particular name and type.
All files of the extensions in this list will be deleted.
True: Read only files will also be deleted. False: Read only files will be skipped.
True: A file will be considered a match for deletion by filename if the name is at least present in the overall filename. False: Only exact matches will be considered.

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.FileLibrary.CopyFile(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Copies a file from one directory to another. If directory does not exist, directory will be created. Returns true if it is confirmed that a new file exists at the destination.
member.param: File path source, including the file name.
File path destination, including the file name. If filename is different, file will be renamed.
True: If file already exists at destination, file will be overwritten.
True: Removes read-only protection. False: Read-only files will not be copied.
Message to display to the user if a file exists.

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.FileLibrary.MoveFile(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves a file from a specified source to destination. May or may not remove the original file depending on parameter inputs. Returns true if all desired operations were successful.
member.param: Path to the original file.
Path to where the original file is to be moved.
True: Original file will be deleted after copy action. False: Original file will be left as is.

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.FileLibrary.ComponentCopyFileAction(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Component function. Copies a file. Includes error messages.
member.param: File path source, including the file name.
File path destination, including the file name. If filename is different, file will be renamed.
True: If file already exists at destination, file will be overwritten.
Message to display to the user if a file exists.

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.FileLibrary.ComponentDeleteFileAction(System.String)
member.summary: Component function. Deletes a file. Includes error messages.
member.param: Path of the file to be deleted.

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.FolderLibrary.DeleteAllFilesAndFolders(System.String,System.Boolean,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Deletes all files and folders, including Read Only. Specifications allow the root folder and other specified folders to be preserved.
member.param: Path to the root folder.
True: The root folder and all files and folders within will be deleted. False: Root folder is preserved but will be empty.
Name of a specific folder to delete.
List of folder paths to preserve during the deleting process. Only works if not deleting the root folder.

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.FolderLibrary.GetDeleteList(System.String,System.Boolean,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Returns a list of directories and subdirectories to delete.
member.param: Path to the root folder.
True: The root folder and all files and folders within will be deleted. False: Root folder is preserved but will be empty.
Name of a specific folder to delete.
List of folder paths to preserve during the deleting process. Only works if not deleting the root folder.

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.FolderLibrary.CopyFolder(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Makes a duplicate folder,including sub-folders. If the destination already exists it will overwrite existing files in this folder. If the destination does not exist, it will be made for you. Returns true if all desired operations were successful.
member.param: Source directory path.
Destination directory path.
True: Destination directory and files will be overwritten if they already exist.

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.FolderLibrary.MoveFolder(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves a file from a specified source to destination. May or may not remove the original file depending on parameter inputs. Returns true if all desired operations were successful.
member.param: Path to the original folder.
Path to where the original folder is to be moved.
True: Original folder will be deleted after copy action. False: Original folder will be left as is.

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.FolderLibrary.CreateReplaceDirectoryAndIncrementNameIfDuplicate(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a directory of the specified path & name. If a current directory exists, the name will either have an incremented number, or if at the max allowed, the highest numbered folder will be deleted first. The function returns the resulting path of the created folder.
member.param: Initial path to use to create the temporary folder.

>= 1. If creating a new temporary destination, more than one can exist if specified. If a current directory exists, the last directory (i.e. the highest number permitted) will be deleted and replaced by a new, blank directory.
member.returns: The resulting path of the created folder.

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.FolderLibrary.ComponentCreateDirectory(System.String)
member.summary: Component function. Creates a new directory. Includes error messages.
member.param: Path of the directory to be created.

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.FolderLibrary.ComponentCopyDirectory(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Component function. Copies a direcotry, or creates a new one if it does not exist at the destination. Includes error messages.
member.param: Source directory path.
Destination directory path.

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.FolderLibrary.ComponentDeleteDirectoryAction(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Component function. Deletes a directory. Includes error messages.
member.param: Path of the file to be deleted.
True: Other files, directories, and subdirectories below this path will be deleted.

member.name: T:MPT.FileSystem.PathLibrary
member.summary: Contains functions for determining and manipulating file paths.

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.PathLibrary.AbsolutePath(System.String@,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks if path is relative or absolute. If path is relative, path is converted to absolute. Returns true if an absolute path was created. False otherwise.
member.param: Path to be checked and, if necessary, converted.
If base reference is relative to the program, specify the relative path difference with this parameter.
Path to which the conversion is related. This is an absolute path.
Optional: If true, then even in development mode the failure warning message is suppressed, but the function returns the relative path.
True: The path will be trimmed of white space, leading and ending "\", and all "\\".

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.PathLibrary.RelativePath(System.String@,System.Boolean,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks if path is relative or absolute. If path is absolute, path is converted to relative.
member.param: Path to be checked and, if necessary, converted.
True: Path is to a file. False (default): Path is to a directory.
If base reference is relative to the program, specify the relative path difference with this parameter.
Path to which the conversion is related. This is an absolute path.
True: The path will be trimmed of white space, leading and ending "\", and all "\\".

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.PathLibrary.ConvertPathAbsoluteToRelative(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Converts absolute path to relative path. Format is not to end relative path with a "\" for folder destinations. Returns basePath[\relativePathFromBase] if fails.
member.param: Absolute path to the base directory, such as that of the running application or DLL.
Absolute path to target directory.
True: Path is to a file. False: Path is assumed to be to a directory.
If base reference is to be relative to the base directory, specify the relative path difference with this parameter. The presence of starting and endings slashes does not matter.
member.remarks: Format right now is to end relative path a "\" for folder destinations.

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.PathLibrary.ConvertPathRelativeToAbsolute(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts relative path to absolute path. Format is not to end relative path with a "\" for folder destinations. Returns basePath[/relativePathFromBase] if fails.
member.param: Absolute path to the base directory, such as that of the running application or DLL.
Relative path to target directory.
If base reference is to be relative to the base directory, specify the relative path difference with this parameter. The presence of starting and endings slashes does not matter.
True: Even in development mode the failure warning message is suppressed, but the function returns the relative path.
member.remarks: Format right now is to end absolute path without a "\".

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.PathLibrary.FileNameHasExtension(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks name provided and determines if name includes file extension by checking for the existing of a "." at the specified spacing from the end. Returns true if extension is found.
member.param: Name to check, as a string.
Number of characters in the file extension after the period. e.g. sdb = 3.

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.PathLibrary.FileNameHasExtension(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether or not the file path provided points to a file with an extension.
member.param: Path to a file, or the file name.
member.remarks: Currently cannot auto determine if path points to a directory vs. a file. This due to the two possible cases: 1. Filename w/o extension listed. 2. Directories with "." in the names.

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.PathLibrary.FileNameHasNoExtension(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether or not the file path provided points to a file with no extension.
member.param: Path to a file, or the file name.
member.remarks: Currently cannot auto determine if path points to a directory vs. a file. This due to the two possible cases: 1. Filename w/o extension listed. 2. Directories with "." in the names.

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.PathLibrary.FileNameExtensionsMatch(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns true if a match is found of either the file name, extension, or both to the full filename and extension. If a name/extension parameter is omitted, it is assumed that any value is a match.
member.param: Full file name with extension. Can also be full file path.
File name to compare.
File extension to compare.
True: File will be matched if any part of the name provided matches the file name. False: File will only be matched if by the name criteria if there is an exact match.

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.PathLibrary.GenericExtensionsMatch(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Checks if the generic file extension, such as *.k??? for any value after k of 3 spaces, matches. Returns true if a match is found.
member.param: Generic file extension to search for.
File extension of the file being checked.

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.PathLibrary.FileName(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the file name included in a path.
member.param: Path to file. Can be relative or absolute.
True: Returns only the name without any file extension. Will not work for files with no extension, but containing a "." in the filename. False: File extension, if present, is not removed.
member.remarks: Currently cannot auto determine if path points to a directory unless the path already exists. This due to the two possible cases: 1. Filename w/o extension listed. 2. Directories with "." in the names.

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.PathLibrary.FileNameWithoutExtension(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the filename without a file extension. This works regardless of whether or not the provided filename has an extension.
member.param: File name to return without an extension.

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.PathLibrary.PathDirectoryStub(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the path to the directory of the filepath provided. If no filename exists, the path is returned minus the lowest directory.
member.param: Path to be checked for the directory.
member.remarks: Currently cannot auto determine if file is in path. This due to the two possible cases: 1. Filename w/o extension listed, 2. Directories with "." in the names

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.PathLibrary.PathDirectorySubStub(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the path to a directory at a number of directories specified above the lowest directory in the path supplied.
member.param: Path to retrieve path directory component from. If this is to a file, the directory containing the file is the lowest one returned (numberOfDirectories=0).

Number of directories to move up in the path supplied. For numberOfDirectories=0, if the path is to a directory, the same path is returned, and if the path is to a file, the path to the directory containing the file is returned.

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.PathLibrary.UniquePathSegment(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a unique path segment for a supplied path, as compared to some other compared path, expressed by other parameters. Path segment will not have a trailing slash.
member.param: List of directory components of the path, in the order occurring in the path.
>=0 Number of directory components in the path that are equal to the path compared.
For each unique directory component. If blank, the directory components themselves are used. If specified, the specification will be an overridden constant.

True: Slashes at the start of the path will also be trimmed.

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.PathLibrary.AddBackSlash(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)

member.param: Path to add slashes to.
True: Adds slash to the start of the path.
False: Slash will not be added to the end of the path.

True: Function will check within all subfolders of the root directory. False: Function will only check root directory.
Only files matching the name specified, but of any file type, will be added.
Only files with the same filetype will be added.
List returned will exclude files of the given filename.

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.StringLibrary.IsNameMatching(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)

Name to be checked.
True: Considered a match as long as the source name contains the checked name, even if the names don match in their entirety.
True: Differences in capitalization will void a potential match. False: Match is made disregarding capitalization.

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.StringLibrary.GetPrefix(System.String,System.String)

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.StringLibrary.FilterFromText(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Finds the first occurrence of a given substring within a string and returns the prefix and/or suffix of the remaining string. If the substring is not found, the original string is returned.
member.param: String to be filtered.
String to filter out.
True: Retain the portion of the string before the filter string.
True: Retain the portion of the string after the filter string.
True: A match is only valid if the filtered string comprises the end of the string. One use is to filter the last directory in a path while avoiding false positives higher up the path hierarchy.
True: Differences in capitalization will void a potential match. False: A match is made disregarding capitalization.
member.remarks: TODO: Refactor into different functions, simpler execution. Add ability to specify number of occurrences of filter.

member.param: String to be searched
Substring segment to search for and be replaced
Substring segment to replace
True: No warning is given if the old substring is not found in the old string.
True: If the old substring equals the old string, the entire string is replaced.
True: Differences in capitalization will void a potential match. False: A match is made disregarding capitalization.

member.summary: Returns a single string character. If the string has more than one character, only the first one is returned.
member.param: Character to potentially trim.

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.StringLibrary.PrependSign(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a sign to the beginning of the target string if one exists at the prior character in the string checked.
member.param: String to add the character to, if applicable.
String to check for the presence of the character.
Index associated with the target string in the string to check.

member.name: M:MPT.FileSystem.StringLibrary.AppendDecimal(System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a decimal to the end of the target string if one exists at the next character in the string checked.
member.param: String to add the character to, if applicable.
String to check for the presence of the character.
Index associated with the target string in the string to check.
